content: Nice clean interface but getting a force close when going to channel list. Pixel 3 Android 11 newest.
replyContent: Hey, thank you for your feedback. What channel and network does this crash happen on? You can email us at help@coreirc.com so that we can try to reproduce the error and implement a fix.

content: I'm very happy to be back on IRC again thanks to this mobile app. Revolution IRC is simply not up to date and this app is offering a nice modern look and has great features too. Furthermore it is new and maintained! Couldn't be more happy at the moment! ðŸŒŸðŸŒŸðŸŒŸðŸŒŸðŸŒŸ
replyContent: Thank you for the kind words! We will keep updating and improving the app, with immediate plans to add the ability to generate and export chat logs in the near future.

content: Use it for xdcc downloads of large files, best on the play store by far. They recently fixed a download bug after I left a review about it, so they definitely have earned this 5 stars in my eyes. Sometimes there are still issues with stopping and trying to restart a download but not a dealbreaker
replyContent: Thank you for your feedback, Cody. We were able to identify the issue causing large downloads to stall, and this is fixed in the latest release. You should now be able to download large files >1GB over a stable WiFi or mobile data connection.

content: thanks you very much . best irc app .. please add auto search channel list
Love it , recommended, please make youtube video for beginners how start with irc chat using this app ... Thanks

Great app but confusing at the start. You need to add your server to the left side tab before you can use it. It is in the settings of the server, with a slider. I would love to see a scripting language!
replyContent: Hi, thank you for the feedback. We are working on recording a number of introductory videos to help new users better understand how to navigate, and get up and running quickly.

content: This is looking pretty good so far. I was stumped for a while as to how to connect after editing a server. The method is not intuitive, but stumbled upon how to connect after much trial and error.
Nice good looking alot of good featues..need somewhere we can ad oper info and any on connect events great job so far!
replyContent: Thank you for your review. Auto commands are now available in the latest version. These are commands that will be sent to the server upon establishing a successful connection.

content: First time I'm paying for an IRC client. Free phone clients are either buggy or lacking in features. CoreIRC seems good enough for my needs. Worth the money. Since I can't find a help #,I'd suggest a few tweaks/issues to be fixed. 1) Can't seem to autocomplete/tab nicks mid sentence. 2)Time stamps of znc doesn't sync with the client. It's important. Otherwise all the previous messages from the buffer appear with the present time stamp. 3) I faced issues initially while editing the port number.
replyContent: Hey, thank you for your kind feedback. 1) The latest version allows you to autocomplete names anywhere in the chat input by typing in the @ symbol and then the first character of the nickname(s) you want to match. 2) This will be fixed in a future update.

content: Works for what I need it to (auto join channel, send command to bots, receive files). Wish I could tap the download notification to open the file though.

It's functional, but there are issues. Disconnect didn't work. I could only disconnect by removing the server. The Identity system requires a new identity for every connection if you connect to a ZNC with multiple networks. Nick completion only works at the beginning of the line. It's fine for basic use, but it won't supplant Revolution IRC for my use.
replyContent: Thank you for your feedback. The latest version now allows nick completion anywhere in the chat input if you type an @ symbol and the first character of the nickname you want to match. There are certain rare cases where disconnect does not as expected, and this will be fixed in a future release.

content: Fantastic app. But one question: Am I crazy or is there not a way to see a list of nicks in channel? Edit: Thanks for the reply. It's definitely not showing any info at all, though. I'll submit a bug report.
replyContent: Thank you for the kind words. When a channel is the currently active tab, you can press the info icon (circled "i") at the top right in order to view channel info - current topic, number of members and a list of nicks. Please include the IRC server you were connected to (or the ircd and version) so that I can try to reproduce and fix asap.

content: Finally, an IRC client with great design. Good work. Keep it up.
very good app. would be nice to use a server more than once for those of us using a bouncer with multiple networks.
replyContent: Thank you for your feedback. There is currently a unique combination check on the server host, port and if the server supports SSL, regardless of network. A workaround would be to have different hostnames (or subdomains) for the same server. This check will be updated in the next version to include the network so that you can use the same server.

content: Nice
Great
Great app
Great app. So functional.
Great App! Love it!
Good
Great start, looking forward to seeing where it goes.
Great beginning for an Android IRC client. The dev is attentive and friendly.
replyContent: Thank you for your feedback. The text retention issue upon screen rotation will be fixed in the next release. Swiping the app off your recents list effectively closes the UI. This will clear the text in the network status view, but the text in channels and private chat will be restored (up to 200 lines). Disabling CTCP can be added as a setting.

content: Good experience so far. Has dark mode, and different methods of authentication. Currently selecting text is very difficult and I haven't seen a way to recall previously sent messages. I'm looking forward to more food work.
replyContent: Thank you for your feedback, Andrew. We're trying to figure out how to make text selection an easy process for users, but it's a little difficult at the moment due to some technical limitations. A setting to change the default "Send" action in the soft keyboard to "Prev" for scrolling previous sent messages will be added in the next release.
